cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi (420 km) SSW of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then turning north-northwest, skirting the Pacific side of Baja California and remaining offshore while progressing toward southern California waters late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest approach to land near the west-central coast of the Baja California peninsula (around Punta Eugenia)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Puerto Cortes to Punta Eugenia; Tropical Storm Watch north of Santa Rosalia to Bahia De Los Angeles and north of Punta Eugenia to San Jose De Las Palomas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Abreojos southward to Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Lucas northward to Santa Rosalia
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Pacific side of the Baja California peninsula, with large swells propagating northward toward the southern California coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (3%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; more likely breezy conditions 25–35 mph late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – only elevated surf and rip currents anticipated
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain 1–2 inches possible Saturday as Kay’s moisture plume reaches southern California
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large southerly swells creating hazardous surf and rip currents that could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations at the port
